dataset.title: ORMEF: Occurrence Records of Mediterranean Exotic Fishes

dataset.abstract: The ORMEF dataset is a comprehensive, and robust compilation of exotic fish observations recorded in the entire Mediterranean region from 1896 to 2020. ORMEF is composed by 4015 georeferenced occurrences distributed in the territorial waters of 20 Mediterranean countries and extracted from 670 scientific published papers. The resultant dataset is a collection of 188 fish taxa whose 106 species entered through the Suez Canal; 256 species introduced by human activities (shipping, mariculture, aquarium release); 576 Atlantic species. The dataset has undergone a severe technical and scientific review for what concerns taxa and geographical accuracy and it consists of a CSV file of the records (observations), including information on all the bibliography from which dataset has been built.
dataset.additionalInfo: The ORMFEF GeoPortal is available at: https://ormef.eu; DOI of related scientific publications: https://doi.org/10.1038/s41597-022-01487-z; https://doi.org/10.3391/mbi.2024.15.4.09
dataset.intellectualRights: Free for use, including sharing and adaptation, by all individuals provided that the owners are acknowledged in any use or publication.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Exotic fish records are distributed in 20 different countries, all over the Mediterranean region.

dataset.acknowledgements: Institute for Marine Biological Resources and Biotechnology (IRBIM) of the National Research Council (CNR) of Ancona

contact.organizationName: National Research Council of Italy (CNR), Institute for Marine Biological Resources and Biotechnology (IRBIM)

methodStep.description: Occurrence records were gathered through an extensive literature search by combining multiple search criteria. Each record was associated with the name of the species, the year of detection, the presumed introduction path, and the country where the species was observed. Each georeferenced observation included in ORMEF undergone a severe quality control and checked for possible geographical and taxonomic biases.

studyExtent.description: Literature search was performed mainly through Google Scholar (https://scholar.google.com/), ISI Web of Science (https://www.webofscience.com/), and Scopus (https://www.scopus.com/).

sampling.samplingDescription: Multiple search criteria were used for literature search including species scientific names and a combination of terms such as exotic, non-indigenous, and alien in conjunction with the names of Mediterranean and/or Mediterranean countries. In addition, periodic checks on the main journals devoted to the publication of exotic fish records were performed to update the database with new georeferenced occurrences. Grey literature was also considered, when accessible.

project.title: 1) ORMEF: Occurrence Records of Mediterranean Exotic Fishes; 2) USEit: Use of operational synergies for the study and integrated management of invasive alien species in Italy

personnel.organizationName: National Research Council of Italy (CNR), Institute for Marine Biological Resources and Biotechnology (IRBIM)

project.abstract: ORMEF is a free, online searchable database about Mediterranean Exotic Fishes available at https://ormef.eu. It provides updated georeferenced information for scientists, conservationists and policy makers, disseminating specialist’s knowledge and experience to a broad audience. The ORMEF dataset was published and made accessible as a CSV file by LifeWatch Italy within the framework of the USEit project.

attribute.attributeDefinition: An identifier (preferably unique) for the record within the data set or collection.

An identifier for the dwc:Occurrence (as opposed to a particular digital record of the dwc:Occurrence). In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, construct one from a combination of identifiers in the record that will most closely make the dwc:occurrenceID globally unique.
The four-digit year in which the dwc:Event occurred, according to the Common Era Calendar.
The integer month in which the dwc:Event occurred.
Comments or notes about the dwc:Event.
The original textual description of the place.
The name of the country or major administrative unit in which the dcterms:Location occurs.

The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in dwc:geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a dcterms:Location. Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in dwc:geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a dcterms:Location. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.
The perpendicular measurement downward from a surface.
The full scientific name of the class in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.
The full scientific name of the order in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.
The full scientific name of the family in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.
The full scientific name of the genus in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.

The full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of a dwc:Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in the dwc:identificationQualifier term.
The authorship information for the dwc:scientificName formatted according to the conventions of the applicable dwc:nomenclaturalCode.
The full name, with authorship and date information if known, of the currently valid (zoological) or accepted (botanical) dwc:Taxon.
An identifier for the name usage (documented meaning of the name according to a source) of the currently valid (zoological) or accepted (botanical) taxon.
The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the dwc:scientificName.
Comments or notes about the dwc:Occurrence.
A number or enumeration value for the quantity of dwc:Organisms.
The type of quantification system used for the quantity of dwc:Organisms.
A range in which a species has evolved or in which it has arrived by natural means.
The degree to which a dwc:Organism survives, reproduces, and expands its range at the given place and time.

codeDefinition.definition: Individuals surviving outside of captivity or cultivation in a location with no reproduction.
Individuals surviving outside of captivity or cultivation in a location. Reproduction occurring and population self-sustaining.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The occurrence or status of an alien species is a prompt start of the entire process for an early warning and rapid response.

codeDefinition.definition: The taxon occurs regularly in this area but only in small numbers.
The taxon may be common in certain years and entirely absent in other years.
The taxon is observed frequently in the area.

attribute.attributeDefinition: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with the dwc:Occurrence.
A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise pointed to by the described resource.
